page.title: 17SYMBISTER HOUSE
page.content: Symbister House,the largest building on Whalsay, was built in the 1830's for the Bruce family who were lairds (landowners) of Whalsay. One of the best examples of Georgian style architecture in Shetland it is built of granite brought from the Shetland mainland,but at such cost that the Bruce family fortunes were severely reduced. It is said locally that the then head of the family did this deliberately so as to leave little to his son, with whom he was on poor relations. During the 1920's and 30's the last laird had to take in paying guests in order to help pay for the upkeep of the house. After his death the building was unoccupied and became almost derelict.In 1963 the council took it over,repairing it and opening it as a school in 1964.
